David Marr

Movrarec paradox - easy for computer to solve thigns that humans can't and hard for computers to solve things that huamns can.
Shifted the burden from algorithm design to data generation. That's a problem because so much data needs to be generated.
algoirthms (classical AI) --> features (machine_learning )--> labels (deep-learning) --> tasks (self-supervised tasks)

Ecological analysis - understandin things with respect to the environment that the agent is trained in.
_why are models the way they are and what are better environments?_
